deposition noun
(LEAVING STH)
[ C or U ]
  geology, science
  specialized the forming of a layer of a substance such as soil or rock, or the layer that is formed: In the stream bed you can find small, rounded calcite pebbles formed by the deposition of layer upon layer of calcium in solution. There is a deposition of minerals from the hot, hydrous fluids within the Earth's crust.
[ C or U ] formal the act of depositing (= leaving) something somewhere, or the substance, object, etc. that is left: Archaeologists have noted ritual depositions of metal objects such as coins or bronze vessels in rivers and marshes.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are researching the genes that play a role in the deposition of fat in the body.Water ice clouds form in planets' mesospheres by vapour deposition at low pressures and temperatures.
